thread.title: Outdoor Gear Retailer REI Taps AWS, Azure for Cloud Services
thread.title_full: Outdoor Gear Retailer REI Taps AWS, Azure for Cloud Services

title: Outdoor Gear Retailer REI Taps AWS, Azure for Cloud Services
text:
CIO Journal. Outdoor Gear Retailer REI Taps AWS, Azure for Cloud Services REI hopes the move will allow the company to perform data analytics faster and provide more personalized customer service By @steven_norton Mar 20, 2017 4:01 pm ET 
REI wants its customers, who are also its co-owners, to spend as much time outside as possible. To accomplish that, the outdoor-sports co-op is upgrading some in-store systems and moving to the cloud to provide speedier and more personalized experiences in the store and on the trail. Technology projects in the pipeline include an in-store [â€¦] Content from our sponsor Deloitte CIO Insights and Analysis from Deloitte Contracts Get Smarter With Blockchains Organizations are actively exploring applications for blockchain-based smart contracts, where blockchains act as shared databases to provide a secure, single source of truth, and smart contracts automate approvals, calculations, and other transaction activities prone to lag and error. Already, institutions are testing use cases aimed at trade clearing and settlement, and supply chain and trade finance documentation. Please note: The Wall Street Journal News Department was not involved in the creation of the content above.
